dnimp
Class Grid

java.lang.Object
  dnimp.Grid

public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object

A representation of a grid with a specified dimension capable of containing a collection of points

A grid describes an object with a collection of points (of type Point), defined by a corner latitude corner longitude as well as characteristic MIJ values. A grid is capable of searching its array of points for specific values on the basis of a point's unique identifier (sourceID) or named points in the set of data correlated to a point. The correlated set of data of the points in the grid is mutable on the basis of its identifier.

Field Detail

mij

public int[] mij
The set of mij values specific to this grid. Initially null and accessible to members.

gridNatT

public double[] gridNatT
Constructor Detail

Grid

public Grid(double auxLonXC,
            double auxLatYC)
Create a grid of a defined latitude and longitude. The grid initially contains an empty set of points.

REQUIRES: auxLonXC, auxLatYC > 0

Parameters:
auxLonXC - the corner longitude of this grid
auxLatYC - the corner latitude of this grid

public void addPoint(Point x)
Adds a point to this Grid.

Parameters:
x - the Point to be added

population

public int population()
Returns the number of points in this grid. 0 if empty.

taggedPop

public int taggedPop()
Returns the number of points in the grid which have correlated data.

tagPoints

public void tagPoints(java.lang.String targetID,
                      Pair[] auxData,
                      java.lang.String latR,
                      java.lang.String lonR)
Adds correlated data to points belonging to the Grid on the basis of its identifier. Multiple points can be tagged as the entire set of point data is searched.

Parameters:
targetID - the identifier
auxData - the set of data to be correlated to the point with identifier targetID

calcMIJ

public void calcMIJ(Pair[] threshData)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Calculates the set of mij values for this grid

Parameters:
threshData - the set of threshold data in the same order as the indices of the mij array.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - occurs if a name sought after in correlated data sets is not found

uniqueID

public int uniqueID()
The number of unique sourceIDs (excluding receptor sites and times) in this grid. All points are considered.

taggedUniqueID

public int taggedUniqueID()
The number of unique sourceIDs in this grid. Only points with tagged data are considered.

changeCWT

public void changeCWT(int polIndex,
                      double ndValue)
A method to modify a single CWT value in the Grid-cell. Important for synchronization with RTWC; important use in World.smoothCWTField

Parameters:
polIndex - pollutant index
ndValue - new value of the CWT[polIndex]: this method was intended to be used to replace a given CWT value with a no-data value in order for recalculations of RTWC to be feasible.

nijmTable

public Pair[] nijmTable()

getCalcCWT

public double[] getCalcCWT(java.lang.String[] varList)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
For all tagged data in this cell, returns an array of CWT values for every pollutant of this grid. A NO DATA VALUE FOR THIS METHOD MUST BE LESS THAN 0 AND NOT EQUAL TO IT. <0)

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getCalcCWTLog

public double[] getCalcCWTLog(java.lang.String[] varList)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
For all tagged data in this cell, returns an array of logarithmic CWT values for every pollutant of this grid. The only difference between this method and getCalcCWT is the use of a logarithmic concentration field, whose use can be user defined.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getCWTUncertainty

public double[] getCWTUncertainty(double confInt,
                                  java.lang.String[] varList,
                                  boolean logUsed)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the uncertainty in CWT values at a specified confidence interval.

Parameters:
confInt - the confidence interval (1-probability) of the desired analysis; in decimal format (e.g. 0.95, 0.999, 0.90)
varList - an array representing the ordered names of all pollutants in this grid
logUsed - true if the concentration field is logarithmic, false if it is not (regular)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getCWTUncertainty

public double getCWTUncertainty(double confInt,
                                int index,
                                java.lang.String polName,
                                boolean logUsed)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the uncertainty in a CWT value at a specified confidence interval, for a specific pollutant!

Parameters:
confInt - the confidence interval (1-probability) of the desired analysis; in decimal format (e.g. 0.95, 0.999, 0.90)
index - an array-index representing the ordered names of all pollutants in this grid
polName - pollutant name
logUsed - true if the concentration field is logarithmic, false if it is not (regular)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

changeConc

public void changeConc(java.lang.String auxUID,
                       int auxIndex,
                       double auxNewValue)
Iterates through all endpoints of this grid: if the matching **UNIQUEID** is found, then the appropriate value is changed. SAFETY: state is left unchanged if sourceID is not found, or if other parameters are invalid

Parameters:
sourceID - - the unique (trajectory) identifier to search for in this grid
auxIndex - - index of the variable list
auxNewValue - - the new value to assign the data to
